meanings.sent1: She always tries to oppugner any changes to the schedule.
meanings.sent2: The protestors oppugnered the new law with determination.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to oppugner the idea of taking a bath.
meanings.sent4: The waves oppugnered the shore relentlessly, never giving up.
meanings.sent5: His stubbornness oppugnered any attempts to convince him otherwise.

meanings.definition: One who opposes or fights against something.
meanings.sent1: The oppugner of the project raised valid concerns.
meanings.sent2: She was known as a fierce oppugner of injustice.
meanings.sent3: The little dog acted like an oppugner to the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: The hero in the story faced the oppugner of darkness in a fierce battle.
meanings.sent5: The oppugner of progress stood firm in their beliefs.
